If you enjoyed the deeper tone of X, I highly recommend "The Sixth Sense" (1999). This classic thriller will keep you on the edge of your seat as you follow the journey of a child psychologist and his young patient who can see dead people. The film's twists and turns are expertly crafted by M. Night Shyamalan.

If you're in the mood for something equally suspenseful but from a different era, I suggest "North by Northwest" (1959). This iconic film noir features Cary Grant as a suave advertising executive on the run from foreign spies, with plenty of twists and turns to keep you guessing. The chemistry between Grant and Eva Marie Saint is undeniable!

Let me know if you'd like more recommendations or have any questions!
